intro: Koellensteinia brachystalix, commonly known as the narrow-leaved koellensteinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant shrub that thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
